page.title: 08Gaddesden Place/Computer Co.
page.content: {Computer Concepts}began in 1982 and moved into Gaddesden Place in 1984. This was part of the Halsey estate and is built in the{Palladian style. As part of the planning permission, the house had to be restored. The company is owned by a man who is only 25 years old. The company employs twelve people at present and hopes to increase to sixteen. It makes programmes for the {BBC computer.}All the people apart from two are under twenty six. None of the staff has any qualifications in computing higher than "A" Level. Since the BBC computer is no longer made, Computer Concepts will be programming for a new computer after 1985. This will be a computer which has the ability to mimic the BBC. We use several Computer Concepts programmes at school.
